channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8282651] ZGC: vmTestbase/gc/ArrayJuggle/ tests fails intermittently with exit code 97
item.description:
Test cases : vmTestbase/gc/ArrayJuggle/Juggle*/TestDescription.java
OS: linux x64 20.04
Where: 11u-cpu
Is it a regression: NO (intermittent failure, failed in few runs in Mach5)
jvm args : -server -XX:+UnlockExperimentalVMOptions -XX:+UseZGC -XX:+CreateCoredumpOnCrash

Failure Log :

item.summary: ZGC: vmTestbase/gc/ArrayJuggle/ tests fails intermittently with exit code 97

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk17u-dev/pull/1431
Date: 2023-06-13 18:54:54 +0000

Fix request [17u]

I backport this for parity with 17.0.8-oracle.
No risk, only a test change.
Clean backport. SAP nightly testing passed.
Fix was pushed while main bug was targeted to '20'. Reset the main bug to fixed in '21' and copied the Robo Duke entry here.

Changeset: 1f438a8a
Author: Ramkumar Sunderbabu <rsunderbabu@openjdk.org>
Committer: Fairoz Matte <fmatte@openjdk.org>
Date: 2023-01-18 06:53:04 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/1f438a8a702034c2f10c0008e72395f526b15ef5

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/11830
Date: 2023-01-03 15:14:10 +0000

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/9645
Date: 2022-07-26 16:18:30 +0000

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/9643
Date: 2022-07-26 15:47:39 +0000

The JuggleTests continuously allocate memory and juggle them in various array positions. Over the course of allocation, heap might be fully filled, esp in high memory strategy. The test doesn't take into account OOME and run under the assumption that any freed memory would be immediately GCed. Immediate GC under memory stress is not guaranteed. Hence it is better to explicitly call WhiteBox API to do the job.

test/hotspot/jtreg/vmTestbase/gc/ArrayJuggle/Juggle01/Juggle01.java
- array[index] = garbageProducer.create(objectSize);
+ try {
+ array[index] = garbageProducer.create(objectSize);
+ } catch (OutOfMemoryError e) {
+ sun.hotspot.WhiteBox.getWhiteBox().youngGC();
+ }
                         }
All the OOME occurrence has happened when memory strategy is high. The load exerted by these tests needs to be reviewed.
